result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Joseph Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To Count 1 in Lafayette County Case No 15-CF-48, 15-CF-89 and Count 2 in Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-93.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay court costs in the amount of $268.00.
Defendant shall pay a DNA Analysis Surcharge in the amount of $250.00.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall comply with any and all mental health regiments including the prescription of medications and/or therapy and sign all necessary releases to allow communications between treatment providers and the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To Count 1 in Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-48, 15-CF-89 and Count 2 in Lafayette County Case No. 15-CF-93.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:33 PM
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to DRI Counts 3-8 Per/Agreement
No objection 
So ordered

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:03 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court raises PSI issue
Attorney Pecora and his client wish to proceed to sentencing today
State calls Roger McDermott to the stand
>Roger McDermott is affirmed and testifies
State moves for recommendation of PSI
Attorney Pecora concurs with the state and makes statement on behalf of his client
Defendant addresses the court
The Court
Counts 1 & 2
Sentence withheld probation for a period of 5 years
Consecutive to the confinement time in 15-CF-48, 15-CF-89 & Ct. 2 in 15-CF-93 (concurrent with all probation).
>Costs, AODA, No estab/consume, Submit to testing, Other probation rules, Counseling & Mental health treatment
209 days credit

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:52 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Pecora informs the court this matter is resolved.
Defendant withdrawals plea of "NOT GUILTY" and enter plea of "GUILTY" to Counts 1 & 2.
Defendant sworn at 3:08 PM.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights.
Court also questions attorney Pecora re: his clients plea and waiver.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis in this case.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to Counts 1 & 2.
Attorney Pecora waives PSI, State concurs with attorney Pecora and moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Court orders PSI to be completed and filed with the court by September 28, 2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 10:12 AM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Pecora moves to continue for a global offer to be made.
No objection.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 2:12 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Joseph Pecora.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Pecora moves to continue and wishes to modify bond.
State objects to any modification.
Attorney Pecora responds to the state's objection.
The Court "DENIES" any modification at this time.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:54 PM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Nancy L. Moore.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Moore moves for withdrawal for reasons stated on the record.
Court grants motion and signs order.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's For Withdrawal of Defense Counsel
Motion hearing on April 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Case called at 9:10 AM.
Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in court with attorney Nancy L. Moore.  Defendant Patrick Joseph Allen in custody.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Moore informs the court her client wishes to waive his preliminary hearing, and files the waiver form with the court.
Court informs the defendant of his right to preliminary hearing and purpose of said hearing.
Court questions defendant re: waiver of preliminary hearing, court also questions attorney Moore re: her clients waiver.
Court finds waiver is made freely, knowingly & intelligently.
Court finds probable cause.
Court accepts waiver and orders defendant be bound over for arraignment.
State files information.
Attorney Moore waives formal reading of information.
Defendant stands "MUTE"
Court enters plea of "NOT GUILTY" on behalf of the defendant.
Attorney Moore moves for signature bond modification.
State objects to any modification.
Court: Denies any modification at this time.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Cash bond set at $1600.00.
Defendant shall reside with his parents in Argyle at all times.
Defendant may leave his home for employment purposes at the Mexican Cheese Producers from 12:30 am to 12:00 noon Monday through Thursday and every other Friday.
If defendant leaves his residence he must be in the company of a parent.  If defendant is able to maintain employment hours may accomodate 1 -2 hrs overtime.
 Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverage.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Cody Young.
